config.question: Who first articulated the doctrine of the implied powers of the federal government?

answer_3.response: Consider This: The idea of implied powers first came up when Washington asked for an opinion on the constitutionality of the national bank. Washington signed the bank act into law after he became convinced that it followed a loose interpretation of the Constitution. See L.O. 7.2 Why did many Americans oppose Alexander Hamilton’s blueprint for national prosperity?
